body.para: This section explains how to input/output a NC program from an external device to the CNC memory. There are 2 methods can be used.

para.style: text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:8px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;
para.text: Method 1: Using Program Editing or Program Folder Screen

para.style: text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:8px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text-align:left; text-indent:14px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:4px; margin-left:48px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

list.style: text-align:left; text-indent:-27px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:8px; margin-left:89px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:200px left ; font-family:Arial; font-size:11pt; color:#000000;

li.style: text-align:left; text-indent:-27px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:8px; margin-left:89px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:200px left ;
li.text: Ensure the NC unit and the external device are ready for reading/writing.

li.style: text-align:left; text-indent:-27px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:8px; margin-left:89px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:200px left ;
li.text: Ensure the user level privilege is enabled to edit NC programs.

li.text: Type the input file name. Press the

li.text: To specify the input program number, type the program number and press the
soft key. For explanation of the operations to be done if a file name or a program number is omitted, please refer to the table below.

li.text: This starts reading the NC program and the word “
INPUT” blinks in the lower right of the screen. To cancel the input of the NC program, press the

li.text: If –9999 is typed, all programs in the memory are output.

list.style: text-align:justify; text-indent:-11px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:8px; margin-left:211px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:211px left ; font-family:Arial; font-size:11pt; color:#000000;

li.text: If no file name is specified, the output file name is assumed to be “O” or “number” if a single program number is specified. If –9999 is specified, the output file name is assumed to be “ALL-PROG.TXT”.

li.text: This starts reading the NC program and the word “OUTPUT” blinks in the lower right of the screen. To cancel the output of the NC program, press the

para.style: text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:62px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;
para.text: This completes the NC program output procedure.
